snippet: A tax-the-rich plan could raise enough to, for example, eliminate all public undergraduate tuition while still allowing wealthy individuals to take home a majority of their income, economists argue.
abstract: Big gulf exists between Democratic and Republican parties over taxing wealthy; some economists say government, following proposals by Democratic presidential candidates, could raise large amounts of revenue exclusively from this small group of taxpayers, while still permitting them to keep majority of their income.
lead_paragraph: A tax-the-rich plan could raise enough to, for example, eliminate all public undergraduate tuition while still allowing wealthy individuals to take home a majority of their income, economists argue.

headline.main: What Could Raising Taxes on the 1% Do? Surprising Amounts
headline.print_headline: Raising Taxes on the Wealthiest Would Pay for Bold Plans
